intro: Chaerophyllum daucophyllum, commonly known as the lesser cow-wheat, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. It is a herbaceous perennial plant that typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or grassland habitats. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in the temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. Due to its ecological importance, it is sometimes considered a rare or endangered species in certain areas.
